CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In most reported cases , the band gaps of conjugated polymers are reduced by incorporating more thiophene units between the donor and the acceptor segments owing to the more extended and delocalized π-electron system. 49-51 However , it was interesting to notice that PIDT-C12NT , which has four thiophenes in each repeat unit , presented a simultaneous bathochromic shift of short wavelength absorption peak to 465 nm and hypsochromic shift of the long wavelength absorption peak to 593 nm along with increased relative intensity of the high and low - energy peaks. Analogous event has also been realized in D-A type of oligomers and polymers based on 3,4bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene or 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene as donor and BT as acceptor , which demonstrated that with the depleting composition of BT unit along the conjugated backbone , the dual absorbing bands were induced to move toward the maximum absorption ( λ max ) of the all - donor homopolymer that located in between of the dual absorbance. 52 In solid state , all polymers showed red - shifted absorption spectra compare to their solution absorption ( Figure 2b ) , which could be ascribed to the aggregation of polymer main chain. We realized a slightly bathochromic shift of the PIDT - DTNT absorbance relative to that of the PIDT - EHNT , which was in consistent with the trend realized in solution , while PIDT-C12NT showed a pronounced bathochromic shift of the low energy band absorption with λ max moved from 593 nm in solution to 619 nm as thin film. It was also worth noting that PIDT-C12NT showed much higher absorption coefficient than other two polymers in the whole visible area. Considering that high photo flux of solar spectrum within the region of about 550-700 nm , more intensified absorption of PIDT-C12NT indicated that more sunlight can be harvested that would potentially lead to higher J sc than the other two polymers. The optical band gaps of the polymers are in the range of 1.64 - 1.69 eV as estimated from the absorption onset and the detailed results are summarized in Table 1. Cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) measurements were carried out to evaluate the molecular frontier orbitals of the resulted polymers. The graphite , platinum wire , and Ag / AgCl were used as the working electrode , counter electrode , and reference electrode , respectively. Polymer films were casted from chlorobenzene solution with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 and all measurements were carried out under inert atmosphere. Figure 3 showed the oxidation of cyclic voltammograms of the polymer films on graphite disk electrode in tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate ( Bu 4 NPF 6 ) solution ( 0.1 M in acetonitrile ) at a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1 .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| D-A type of oligomers and polymers |
| BT |
| EHNT |

Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| D-A type of oligomers and polymers |
| BT |
| EHNT |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT |
| PIDT-C12NT |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material Name":

* "D-A type of oligomers and polymers" - This entity refers to a type of molecule, not a material name.
* "BT" - This entity is an abbreviation for a chemical compound, not a material name.
* "EHNT" - This entity is an abbreviation for a chemical compound, not a material name.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In most reported cases , the band gaps of conjugated polymers are reduced by incorporating more thiophene units between the donor and the acceptor segments owing to the more extended and delocalized π-electron system. 49-51 However , it was interesting to notice that PIDT-C12NT , which has four thiophenes in each repeat unit , presented a simultaneous bathochromic shift of short wavelength absorption peak to 465 nm and hypsochromic shift of the long wavelength absorption peak to 593 nm along with increased relative intensity of the high and low - energy peaks. Analogous event has also been realized in D-A type of oligomers and polymers based on 3,4bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene or 2-ethylhexyloxy-substituted 3,4-propylenedioxythiophene as donor and BT as acceptor , which demonstrated that with the depleting composition of BT unit along the conjugated backbone , the dual absorbing bands were induced to move toward the maximum absorption ( λ max ) of the all - donor homopolymer that located in between of the dual absorbance. 52 In solid state , all polymers showed red - shifted absorption spectra compare to their solution absorption ( Figure 2b ) , which could be ascribed to the aggregation of polymer main chain. We realized a slightly bathochromic shift of the PIDT - DTNT absorbance relative to that of the PIDT - EHNT , which was in consistent with the trend realized in solution , while PIDT-C12NT showed a pronounced bathochromic shift of the low energy band absorption with λ max moved from 593 nm in solution to 619 nm as thin film. It was also worth noting that PIDT-C12NT showed much higher absorption coefficient than other two polymers in the whole visible area. Considering that high photo flux of solar spectrum within the region of about 550-700 nm , more intensified absorption of PIDT-C12NT indicated that more sunlight can be harvested that would potentially lead to higher J sc than the other two polymers. The optical band gaps of the polymers are in the range of 1.64 - 1.69 eV as estimated from the absorption onset and the detailed results are summarized in Table 1. Cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) measurements were carried out to evaluate the molecular frontier orbitals of the resulted polymers. The graphite , platinum wire , and Ag / AgCl were used as the working electrode , counter electrode , and reference electrode , respectively. Polymer films were casted from chlorobenzene solution with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 and all measurements were carried out under inert atmosphere. Figure 3 showed the oxidation of cyclic voltammograms of the polymer films on graphite disk electrode in tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate ( Bu 4 NPF 6 ) solution ( 0.1 M in acetonitrile ) at a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1 .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's go through the paragraph and identify the values of material properties.

1. Band gap:
The band gap of conjugated polymers is reduced by incorporating more thiophene units between the donor and acceptor segments. The band gap of the polymers is in the range of 1.64 - 1.69 eV.

Property Value: Band gap = 1.64 - 1.69 eV

2. Thiophene units:
The polymer PIDT-C12NT has four thiophene units in each repeat unit.

Property Value: Thiophene units = 4

3. Donor and acceptor segments:
The donor and acceptor segments are 3,4-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene and benzothienothiophene (BT), respectively.

Property Value: Donor = 3,4-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene, Acceptor = Benzothienothiophene (BT)

4. Solid-state absorption spectrum:
The absorption spectrum of the polymers in solid state is shifted redward compared to their solution absorption.

Property Value: Solid-state absorption spectrum = Red-shifted

5. Absorption coefficient:
The absorption coefficient of PIDT-C12NT is higher than that of the other two polymers in the whole visible area.

Property Value: Absorption coefficient = Higher for PIDT-C12NT

6. Photo flux:
The photo flux of solar spectrum within the region of about 550-700 nm is higher than the band gap of the polymers.

Property Value: Photo flux = Higher than band gap

7. Molecular frontier orbitals:
The molecular frontier orbitals of the resulted polymers were evaluated using cyclic voltammetry (CV) measurements.

Property Value: Molecular frontier orbitals = Evaluated using CV measurements

8. Electrode materials:
The working electrode, counter electrode, and reference electrode used in CV measurements were graphite, platinum wire, and Ag / AgCl, respectively.

Property Value: Electrode materials = Graphite, platinum wire, Ag / AgCl

9. Solution concentration:
The concentration of the polymer solution used for casting the films was 8 mg mL^-1.

Property Value: Solution concentration = 8 mg mL^-1

10. Scan rate:
The scan rate of the CV measurements was 50 mV s^-1.

Property Value: Scan rate = 50 mV s^-1

Here are the valid entities identified in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Band gap = 1.64 - 1.69 eV |
| Thiophene units = 4 |
| Donor = 3,4-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)thiophene |
| Acceptor = Benzothienothiophene (BT) |
| Solid-state absorption spectrum = Red-shifted |
| Absorption coefficient = Higher for PIDT-C12NT |
| Photo flux = Higher than band gap |
| Molecular frontier orbitals = Evaluated using CV measurements |
| Electrode materials = Graphite, platinum wire, Ag / AgCl |
| Solution concentration = 8 mg mL^-1 |
| Scan rate = 50 mV s^-1 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities that refer to the "Value of material property" in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Band gap = 1.64 - 1.69 eV |
| Absorption coefficient = Higher for PIDT-C12NT |
| Photo flux = Higher than band gap |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to the "Value of material property":

* Donor and acceptor segments (these are the materials used to create the conjugated polymers)
* Solid-state absorption spectrum (this refers to the absorption spectrum of the polymers in solid state, but the value of this property is not mentioned in the paragraph)
* Molecular frontier orbitals (this refers to the electronic structure of the molecules, but the value of this property is not mentioned in the paragraph)
* Electrode materials (these are the materials used in the cyclic voltammetry measurements, but the value of this property is not mentioned in the paragraph)
* Solution concentration (this refers to the concentration of the polymer solution used for casting the films, but the value of this property is not mentioned in the paragraph)
* Scan rate (this refers to the rate at which the potential is scanned during cyclic voltammetry measurements, but the value of this property is not mentioned in the paragraph)
